a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Number of coral bleaching events, World
The number of moderate (up to 30% of corals affected) and severe coral bleaching events (more than 30% corals)
measured at 100 fixed global locations. Bleaching occurs when stressful conditions cause corals to expel their
Data source: Hughes, T. P., et al. (2018). Spatial and temporal patterns of mass bleaching of corals in the Anthropocene.
